intro: Stoechas officinarum, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often aromatic, while the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
